importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating when the public learned of Doug Martin's death and the ongoing investigation into police actions during his detention.

The date of Doug Martin's NFL draft selection as the 31st overall pick in the first round of the 2012 NFL draft, marking the beginning of his professional career and establishing his prominence in American football.
The year in which Martin had a standout performance with 1,402 rushing yards and six touchdowns, leading to his second Pro Bowl selection and reinforcing his reputation as a top-tier running back.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: This period covers the peak of Doug Martin's NFL career, during which he achieved major accolades and became a central figure in the Tampa Bay Buccaneers' history.

keyTakeAways: Former NFL running back Doug Martin died after a brief struggle with police officers during a break-in investigation in Oakland.
Martin was 36 years old at the time of his death and had a distinguished career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, including being a first-team All-Pro and Pro Bowl selection.
Martin was the 31st overall pick in the 2012 NFL Draft and finished his career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns.
The Oakland Police Department stated that Martin was involved in a break-in and had a brief struggle during detention, but did not release further details.
The Alameda County Coroner’s Office confirmed that an autopsy would be conducted to determine the cause of death.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Tampa Bay Buccaneers history, highlighting his lasting impact on the franchise.
His family requested privacy during the grieving process, while Oakland Mayor Barbara Lee and the Buccaneers expressed condolences.
The incident raises broader questions about police use of force, especially in cases involving former athletes and criminal investigations.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, known for his standout career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at age 36 after a brief struggle with Oakland Police Department officers during an investigation into a home break-in. The officers reported a 'brief struggle' as they attempted to detain him, and he was transported to a hospital where he later died; the cause of death has not been released. Martin, selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft, had a career spanning six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders, accumulating 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns. He was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers history and earned multiple Pro Bowl and All-Pro honors. The incident has sparked public concern about police conduct and safety, particularly involving high-profile individuals. The Oakland Mayor and the Buccaneers both expressed condolences, and an autopsy is scheduled to determine the cause of death. The family has requested privacy during their time of mourning.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Police Detention in Oakland
